data.author: ART123
data.content: This is no more remote that every other prospect in AUS. Everywhere is remote. What is the plan here? If the Hussar re-entry/extended drill is a resounding success and huge Bcf's of Helium and Hydrogen are gushing out then they won't be able to get much of it out with just one well. Is there a plan anywhere to drill multiple wells? If so how many? Cheers in advance.

data.author: Sir_Hector
data.content: The site is mindbogglingly remote, getting anything out there is difficult hence the importance of the road and airstrip. They’ll need to drill for water too, can’t keep hauling that in too! I’m not surprised only 12k available. Trading around 1m shares atm so very much small beer. We won’t see any large sells until the price moves. If the news is good some will cash in as there’s no shortage of people waiting to see if they’ll buy in.

data.author: Sir_Hector
data.content: A foot or two? There will be no earth moving machines or imported aggregate, the existing will be dressed and graded nothing more. The airstrip will only be used by light aircraft to ferry a small crew in and out, this is common in Australia and they are robust to cope with dirt strips. Anything like material and plant will have to be hauled in by road, hence the need to ensure the dirt highway is serviceable.

data.author: miker444
data.content: I'm sure A Hamilton is as upbeat as the rest of us now that things are moving, literally. data.author: Sir_Hector
data.content: I’ve been hoping the google earth data will update sometime soon. It seems that most remote areas get a pass every 3 years or so, so we should be due one this year! Hopefully with lots of activity! The ~Copernicus pass is just a bit too low resolution to be useful. Maybe when there is some more significant change it will be obvious. It certainly doesn’t look to have changed dramatically since the last google earth image so hopefully there isn’t significant water damage. In truth, the weather event only had to cause a problem with a small section of the main highway to make getting there almost impossible. I guess we;ll find out shortly when we get the first report from boots on the ground in a few days.

data.author: Sir_Hector
data.content: I quite agree Mike. People make mistakes all the time, but unless you’re prepared to risk going out on a limb you’re not going to achieve too much. AH has taken a significant risk with this, but, has mitigated those risks very astutely. Re-entry rather than new bores. Cherry picked old sites with known histories. Kept below the radar with all the initial planning using local experts to navigate the approvals system. Getting big players interested and on board with his plans. Securing funding without resorting to the issuing of billions of shares. This whole programme of activity seems to be very well considered and executed to me. It’s easy to sit at your keyboard and pick holes, any fool can do that, and I’m sure we are about to hear from some of them!

data.author: miker444
data.content: 20 or 30 Boiler Room Day Traders as we have seen practically from day 1 trying to make £100 - £200. Let them. We are rubbing shoulders with giants i.e Schlumberger & Santos, £50bn & £22bn MarCap's respectively. They will be long gone before year end. As for A Hamilton playing silly games How many CEO's does anyone know who has secured funds ($25m)  worth a multiple of 6 x (600%) of their own MarCap, and NOT have to pay a single penny back. It is UNHEARD of, plain and simple. No Dilution to shareholders and will fund 3 x drills. It's a master stroke and if this is him playing silly games I hope he gets even sillier.

data.content: Why would you name a rig company and give a date of 25 feb for confirmation if they were still evaluating rates or tenders? data.content: Still think they are way ahead of what we know, 26th jan funding rns, 10 days later we have selected the rig, issued RFQs and have named the rig company ( doesnt normally happen) and also told subject to confirmation  25 feb  ( again no need to mention this). If they were still negotiating rates or valuating tenders then " in discussion with rig owners wiuldve sufficed. But naming a rig and giving dates means they have agreement with explorer rig and just needing sign off  now once the site visit is completed . Was it necessary for AH to say what he said if there was no agreement with a ri

data.content: Always sellers m8, no matter the status of a share, the majority of seed funders, those p and d wongas ( II my arse) in placings etc, etc, since they emerged in the late 90's , when the real investment houses and banks pulled right back. data.author: ifiknewidberich9
data.content: Would not get bogged down with the labels Sir H, they are nothing to do with the mm's or market, just 3rd party sites like this one rehashing the real LSE TRADE print and adding a BEST GUESS, with the worlds worst Algorithm. As much use as a chocolate tea pot, so the associated stats like buy v sell volume ratio's etc, likewise WORTHLESS. The worlds markets label NOTHING, just print TRADES, they consider ALL being both a buy and sell, hence no labelling. Always multiple prices in play, not just what you see, Canadian exchange a good learning ground, they print the two brokers/institutions involved in the TRADE but if you look at what those parties have on the board for their buy and sell prices, they often do not match up. The Dimbo Algo, all GUESSES based on what IT thinks is current mid price and range, no matter when the TRADE placed 3 mins or 3 days ago. All above IT'S MID price = BUY------------------------Never the case All below IT'S MID price = SELL-----------------------Ditto All exactly on its MID , ALL delayed trades, not black trades, mm dark arts nonsense etc and anything it see's as outside of ITS now status range CHOKES = UNKNOWN, the alternate colour codes, follow the same garbage logic patterns. It's as simple and tragic as that, markets offered the simple modern tech fix, to add real time data at source, declined choosing TRADITION over tech BUT you could also say, quite happy to leave us all in the dark and confusion reign via 3rd party sites like this one adding GUESSES to all TRADES. 🙄

data.author: JamesTrader71
data.content: SP above 8p at eg 10p has to be the bare minimum new floor here and now  as we know because of this 8p note marker so no volume other than bits from retail will be selling lower than at least 10p or there’s no money in it for the note holders and this is their business mode;. I expect they won’t start selling seriously until we get to 16p minimum Debt Facility The First Drawdown of £300,000 occurred on 4th November 2025 and is convertible at 8 pence per share ("Reference Price") and each drawdown thereafter at a 50% premium to the 5-day VWAP preceding the drawdown. There is no interest to be applied to the loan. The Company has now undertaken a Second Drawdown of £500,000 on the same terms as that agreed for the First Drawdown, that being convertible at a premium of 8.00 pence. Issue of Warrants The Investor shall receive Warrants equal to 40% of each drawdown divided by the Reference Price, exercisable at a 50% premium to the relevant Reference Price being 8.00 pence (2.5 million warrants). Each issuance of Warrants will have a 48-month term from the date of issuance (which may be offset against outstanding debt if exercised). As with the First Drawdown, the Second Drawdown warrants will be exercisable at 8 pence.

data.author: Just_us
data.content: DAI, I vaguely remember you posting on the HE1 bb and don't remember you being a troll so I'll treat you as a genuine poster 😉 Your comment about people losing money if they bought in at 10p is absurd. If they bought in at that level and sold before the drill turned that's nobody's fault but there own. This is oil and gas and shxt happens, which brings me to your other snippets. I believe it was always GEX intention to have the offtaker fund the drill. Whether that was 2024, 25 or 26. Which would make their fully funded statement factually correct would it not? Yes they are delayed by a year due to a once in 80 years weather event and an expansion of the permit area, for which they have had to raise funds via placing and an interest free debt facility. Personally I think they have done a fantastic job of keeping Dilution to a minimum. This game ain't cheap Fact is if the drills successful, whether you bought in at 2.5p 0r 20p quite frankly you'll be laughing 😃. GLA

data.author: ifiknewidberich9
data.content: The new name for Mt Kitty, changed due to ""objection to name"" by the indigenous  people. Farmout discussions are progressing on Jack Bore 2 (EP125) to secure part funding for an appraisal well, to be drilled within 12 months. The proposed Jacko Bore 2 exploration well will target helium, naturally-occurring hydrogen and natural gas in the fractured basement by re-entering the existing Mt Kitty-1 (Jacko Bore-1) well and drilling a deviated/horizontal side track to test up to 500m of the fractured basement reservoir at a depth of approximately 2,000m. The vertical Mt Kitty-1 exploration well flowed gas containing 11.5% hydrogen and 9% helium at up to 530,000 scfd. The Dukas-1 exploration well (EP112) was drilled in 2019 and suspended after it encountered hydrocarbon-bearing gas from an over pressured zone close to the primary target, with traces of helium and hydrogen detected in mud gases. Central is progressing discussions to secure farmout funding for a new well at Dukas which will target the same sub-salt Heavitree formation with a higher-capacity rig. The interest holder has conducted activities in the project area since 2013, including 645.8 km of seismic acquisition (645.8 ha) and drilling of the Jacko Bore 1 well (previously named Mt Kitty 1) on the well site to be re-established, involving 53.47 ha of land clearing. During stakeholder engagement, a concern was raised by the Imanpa community’s Traditional Owners about the name of the proposed appraisal well; Mt Kitty 2. To better reflect the cultural connection to the location, the original name of this activity, and the previously named Mt Kitty 1 well have been renamed to Jacko Bore 1 DW1 and Jacko Bore 1, respectively. The proposed well will be a horizontal/highly deviated well, which will be drilled from the existing Jacko Bore 1 surface hole. If the casing on Jacko Bore 1 fails, this well will be plugged and abandoned. The horizontal Jacko Bore 2 well will then be drilled approximately 20 metres from the existing well.

data.author: LAvvocato
data.content: Today seems to have calmed down after a ridiculous start with the nonsense being spouted. Let’s just look at clarifying some of the nonsense and wilful admissions that were posted earlier with the sole purpose of creating doubt without due process or consideration. What we know …. Harlequin has confirmed various points this week including funding. In order to do this and for the announcement to be made, they would have had to show proof of funds. Not just to GEX but to their independent advisors. Legal and financial. If anyone is casting doubt on this then they should be asking questions of those advisors. They are professional service firms after all. Schlumberger have also been announced. For this to happen Schlumberger would have also had to have signed off on any announcement which involved them.. They as the worlds largest contractor would not have done this lightly… AH also confirmed in his interview that he has been engaged with them. Bjet/Newbie/Dumley have ignored this through ignorance or stupidity, or both, or more seriously an attempt to scare investors…. They’ve then looked at companies house which only provides a snapshot of activity in England and Wales. Believing that to be the optimum source of information whilst wilfully ignoring what each company or individuals maybe doing elsewhere or where the money sits which is actually the key. This is not the gotcha that they think it is. Even on a basic level. Why would a US family route money through the U.K. for an Australian project? Given the current UK tax regime  I’d also question the sanity of any E&P company being domiciled here or having a footprint without or without any assets in the U.K. All of this was done to sow discord amongst shareholders for no reason or for a reason which is yet to be discovered . Especially given the fact that they aren’t shareholders. Are there issues to be dealt with on GEX - yes. Is it perfect - no. Is it been a slightly rough ride - yes The rubbish that was posted earlier should frankly be investigated. They all claim to be asking “valid questions” but with no journalistic credibility and with the pompous self righteousness of Winnifrith and his ilk. Ignoring the obvious and promoting the irrelevant. It’s been a good week for the long term holders. I’m just fed up with the nonsense that was posted and people believing they have a gotcha when they don’t have a clue. Have a good weekend one and all!

data.author: Sir_Hector
data.content: Well there is a quarterly timeline in the RNS for the Hussar activity. I’d expect to see news of orders for long lead items and the drill rig selection in the course of the next six weeks or so. After that we can possibly expect to see evidence of boots on the ground activity, I’m sure there will be pics made available when appropriate. And then from June news of progress and rig status right up to drill. States ambition is to complete the initial drill in Q3, although by this time the winter weather may have impacted. I’d hope they have this planned in. And, on top of all that there are the workstreams relating to Mt Winter prospect and the Jacko Bore etc, which should provide plenty of opportunities for positive news releases. I’m sure AH wouldn’t have teased the likely news streams if he wasn’t confident they were going to be forthcoming (although there are some on here who say he can’t be trusted). I fully expect to see the value of the company index up at each release as confidence grows. If gas flows from Hussar in the predicted manner by the end of Q3 then I expect the MC to hit £100m

data.author: Sir_Hector
data.content: I’ve stopped looking at the trades. Nothing makes any sense to me, it’s just people playing. The numbers are so small in the scheme of things. As has been pointed out elsewhere, you are either a trader and see this as a trading share and the BoD complicit in this. Or, you see it as an investment in a potentially fantastic venture and the BoD are all good eggs. You can’t sit in both camps and the traders don’t understand the investors, and the investors don’t understand the traders. At some point in time we’ll find out if there is gas and the investors have done well. Or, it’s all been smoke and mirrors and the traders have made off with the investor’s capital. There will be some news shortly I’m sure.

data.author: Sir_Hector
data.content: I quite agree Mike. People make mistakes all the time, but unless you’re prepared to risk going out on a limb you’re not going to achieve too much. AH has taken a significant risk with this, but, has mitigated those risks very astutely. Re-entry rather than new bores. Cherry picked old sites with known histories. Kept below the radar with all the initial planning using local experts to navigate the approvals system. Getting big players interested and on board with his plans. Securing funding without resorting to the issuing of billions of shares. This whole programme of activity seems to be very well considered and executed to me. It’s easy to sit at your keyboard and pick holes, any fool can do that, and I’m sure we are about to hear from some of them!

data.author: ifiknewidberich9
data.content: Would not get bogged down with the labels Sir H, they are nothing to do with the mm's or market, just 3rd party sites like this one rehashing the real LSE TRADE print and adding a BEST GUESS, with the worlds worst Algorithm. As much use as a chocolate tea pot, so the associated stats like buy v sell volume ratio's etc, likewise WORTHLESS. The worlds markets label NOTHING, just print TRADES, they consider ALL being both a buy and sell, hence no labelling. Always multiple prices in play, not just what you see, Canadian exchange a good learning ground, they print the two brokers/institutions involved in the TRADE but if you look at what those parties have on the board for their buy and sell prices, they often do not match up. The Dimbo Algo, all GUESSES based on what IT thinks is current mid price and range, no matter when the TRADE placed 3 mins or 3 days ago. All above IT'S MID price = BUY------------------------Never the case All below IT'S MID price = SELL-----------------------Ditto All exactly on its MID , ALL delayed trades, not black trades, mm dark arts nonsense etc and anything it see's as outside of ITS now status range CHOKES = UNKNOWN, the alternate colour codes, follow the same garbage logic patterns. It's as simple and tragic as that, markets offered the simple modern tech fix, to add real time data at source, declined choosing TRADITION over tech BUT you could also say, quite happy to leave us all in the dark and confusion reign via 3rd party sites like this one adding GUESSES to all TRADES. 🙄

data.author: JamesTrader71
data.content: SP above 8p at eg 10p has to be the bare minimum new floor here and now  as we know because of this 8p note marker so no volume other than bits from retail will be selling lower than at least 10p or there’s no money in it for the note holders and this is their business mode;. I expect they won’t start selling seriously until we get to 16p minimum Debt Facility The First Drawdown of £300,000 occurred on 4th November 2025 and is convertible at 8 pence per share ("Reference Price") and each drawdown thereafter at a 50% premium to the 5-day VWAP preceding the drawdown. There is no interest to be applied to the loan. The Company has now undertaken a Second Drawdown of £500,000 on the same terms as that agreed for the First Drawdown, that being convertible at a premium of 8.00 pence. Issue of Warrants The Investor shall receive Warrants equal to 40% of each drawdown divided by the Reference Price, exercisable at a 50% premium to the relevant Reference Price being 8.00 pence (2.5 million warrants). Each issuance of Warrants will have a 48-month term from the date of issuance (which may be offset against outstanding debt if exercised). As with the First Drawdown, the Second Drawdown warrants will be exercisable at 8 pence.

data.author: ifiknewidberich9
data.content: Would not get bogged down with the labels Sir H, they are nothing to do with the mm's or market, just 3rd party sites like this one rehashing the real LSE TRADE print and adding a BEST GUESS, with the worlds worst Algorithm. As much use as a chocolate tea pot, so the associated stats like buy v sell volume ratio's etc, likewise WORTHLESS. The worlds markets label NOTHING, just print TRADES, they consider ALL being both a buy and sell, hence no labelling. Always multiple prices in play, not just what you see, Canadian exchange a good learning ground, they print the two brokers/institutions involved in the TRADE but if you look at what those parties have on the board for their buy and sell prices, they often do not match up. The Dimbo Algo, all GUESSES based on what IT thinks is current mid price and range, no matter when the TRADE placed 3 mins or 3 days ago. All above IT'S MID price = BUY------------------------Never the case All below IT'S MID price = SELL-----------------------Ditto All exactly on its MID , ALL delayed trades, not black trades, mm dark arts nonsense etc and anything it see's as outside of ITS now status range CHOKES = UNKNOWN, the alternate colour codes, follow the same garbage logic patterns. It's as simple and tragic as that, markets offered the simple modern tech fix, to add real time data at source, declined choosing TRADITION over tech BUT you could also say, quite happy to leave us all in the dark and confusion reign via 3rd party sites like this one adding GUESSES to all TRADES. 🙄

data.author: ifiknewidberich9
data.content: The new name for Mt Kitty, changed due to ""objection to name"" by the indigenous  people. Farmout discussions are progressing on Jack Bore 2 (EP125) to secure part funding for an appraisal well, to be drilled within 12 months. The proposed Jacko Bore 2 exploration well will target helium, naturally-occurring hydrogen and natural gas in the fractured basement by re-entering the existing Mt Kitty-1 (Jacko Bore-1) well and drilling a deviated/horizontal side track to test up to 500m of the fractured basement reservoir at a depth of approximately 2,000m. The vertical Mt Kitty-1 exploration well flowed gas containing 11.5% hydrogen and 9% helium at up to 530,000 scfd. The Dukas-1 exploration well (EP112) was drilled in 2019 and suspended after it encountered hydrocarbon-bearing gas from an over pressured zone close to the primary target, with traces of helium and hydrogen detected in mud gases. Central is progressing discussions to secure farmout funding for a new well at Dukas which will target the same sub-salt Heavitree formation with a higher-capacity rig. The interest holder has conducted activities in the project area since 2013, including 645.8 km of seismic acquisition (645.8 ha) and drilling of the Jacko Bore 1 well (previously named Mt Kitty 1) on the well site to be re-established, involving 53.47 ha of land clearing. During stakeholder engagement, a concern was raised by the Imanpa community’s Traditional Owners about the name of the proposed appraisal well; Mt Kitty 2. To better reflect the cultural connection to the location, the original name of this activity, and the previously named Mt Kitty 1 well have been renamed to Jacko Bore 1 DW1 and Jacko Bore 1, respectively. The proposed well will be a horizontal/highly deviated well, which will be drilled from the existing Jacko Bore 1 surface hole. If the casing on Jacko Bore 1 fails, this well will be plugged and abandoned. The horizontal Jacko Bore 2 well will then be drilled approximately 20 metres from the existing well.

data.author: LAvvocato
data.content: Today seems to have calmed down after a ridiculous start with the nonsense being spouted. Let’s just look at clarifying some of the nonsense and wilful admissions that were posted earlier with the sole purpose of creating doubt without due process or consideration. What we know …. Harlequin has confirmed various points this week including funding. In order to do this and for the announcement to be made, they would have had to show proof of funds. Not just to GEX but to their independent advisors. Legal and financial. If anyone is casting doubt on this then they should be asking questions of those advisors. They are professional service firms after all. Schlumberger have also been announced. For this to happen Schlumberger would have also had to have signed off on any announcement which involved them.. They as the worlds largest contractor would not have done this lightly… AH also confirmed in his interview that he has been engaged with them. Bjet/Newbie/Dumley have ignored this through ignorance or stupidity, or both, or more seriously an attempt to scare investors…. They’ve then looked at companies house which only provides a snapshot of activity in England and Wales. Believing that to be the optimum source of information whilst wilfully ignoring what each company or individuals maybe doing elsewhere or where the money sits which is actually the key. This is not the gotcha that they think it is. Even on a basic level. Why would a US family route money through the U.K. for an Australian project? Given the current UK tax regime  I’d also question the sanity of any E&P company being domiciled here or having a footprint without or without any assets in the U.K. All of this was done to sow discord amongst shareholders for no reason or for a reason which is yet to be discovered . Especially given the fact that they aren’t shareholders. Are there issues to be dealt with on GEX - yes. Is it perfect - no. Is it been a slightly rough ride - yes The rubbish that was posted earlier should frankly be investigated. They all claim to be asking “valid questions” but with no journalistic credibility and with the pompous self righteousness of Winnifrith and his ilk. Ignoring the obvious and promoting the irrelevant. It’s been a good week for the long term holders. I’m just fed up with the nonsense that was posted and people believing they have a gotcha when they don’t have a clue. Have a good weekend one and all!

data.author: Sir_Hector
data.content: Well there is a quarterly timeline in the RNS for the Hussar activity. I’d expect to see news of orders for long lead items and the drill rig selection in the course of the next six weeks or so. After that we can possibly expect to see evidence of boots on the ground activity, I’m sure there will be pics made available when appropriate. And then from June news of progress and rig status right up to drill. States ambition is to complete the initial drill in Q3, although by this time the winter weather may have impacted. I’d hope they have this planned in. And, on top of all that there are the workstreams relating to Mt Winter prospect and the Jacko Bore etc, which should provide plenty of opportunities for positive news releases. I’m sure AH wouldn’t have teased the likely news streams if he wasn’t confident they were going to be forthcoming (although there are some on here who say he can’t be trusted). I fully expect to see the value of the company index up at each release as confidence grows. If gas flows from Hussar in the predicted manner by the end of Q3 then I expect the MC to hit £100m

data.author: LAvvocato
data.content: Newbie/Dumley I know this must be a difficult week for you with positive news. I have no idea why Halo were given the extension. I also don’t care. Harlequin gave notice that they will proceed with the funding of the well and other costs. Without this notice having previously expressed interest there can be no contract… One step at a time. In order to do this they would have to provide proof of funding not just to GEX but to their external advisors. If you think they are compromised then take it up with them. Harlequin are based in the Caymans. Companies House is therefore irrelevant. They’ve also engaged the world’s largest contractor…. I hope that this helps. It’s not difficult to grasp so why are you struggling?? You’re also not a shareholder. This is a shareholder forum not a platform for ill informed non shareholding keyboard warriors to spout what they like….

company_30s.what_they_do: GEX.L is an exploration and development company that focuses on drilling and extracting rare minerals, including Helium‑3, from remote sites such as Mt Winter.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Helium‑3 is a sought‑after resource for clean fusion energy and advanced electronics, and the company’s projects are positioned to supply that future market.
company_30s.current_state: The firm has been actively raising debt and buying complementary assets to strengthen its drilling pipeline. It is still in the early stages of production and has not yet generated revenue, but recent off‑take agreements and resource upgrades suggest a path toward cash flow.

rns_narrative: The company has been busy closing a £500,000 debt drawdown and securing several off‑take memoranda to lock in future buyers.
It has also announced a 37.8% upgrade to its Mt Winter resource, showing that the drilling has uncovered more promising material.
These moves signal a survival strategy – the company is clearing its balance sheet and proving the viability of its projects before the market takes notice.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: Historically, deep‑crash signals (like a 70‑95% drop) bounce on average 39% when the price starts to recover. A 50% rebound would more than double the current price, giving a 1:5 risk‑reward if you stop a modest 20% below the entry.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The worst that could happen is a small further dip – the market has already shed 80% of its value, so any additional downside is limited.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk 20% down versus a potential 100%+ upside – an asymmetric 1:5 trade.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter with 25% of your allocated capital now, use a tight stop just below the recent low, and add 25% more if volume confirms a move higher. Keep the position size small until the price shows clear momentum.
playbook.if_watching: Hold until a news catalyst (drilling result, new off‑take, or funding announcement) or a clear volume spike on a daily close above the current price. Then consider a partial entry.
playbook.if_passing: Skip this stock only if a clear delisting or bankruptcy risk emerges; otherwise the deep‑crash setup is worth a contrarian bet.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Deep crash, no chatter, and a series of survival moves – classic contrarian play with a 1:5 risk‑reward.
